definition: emptiness/void/abstract theory or guiding principles/empty or unoccupied/diffident or timid/false/humble or modest/(of health) weak/virtual/in vain

sentences.english: BEFORE the advent of male vanity, the local barbershop used to be a regaling hotspot.
sentences.chinese: 由於男性的虛榮心，當地的理髮館一直以來生意興隆。

sentences.english: It is very often nothing but our own vanity that deceives us.
sentences.chinese: 我們往往會因爲我們自己的虛榮心，而給弄迷了心竅。

sentences.english: My poet's vanity dies in shame before thy sight.
sentences.chinese: 我的詩人的虛榮心，在你的容光中羞死。

sentences.english: Finally a vanity tool that doesnâ€™t despise you!
sentences.chinese: 終於，一面滿足你虛榮心的工具不再輕視你。

sentences.english: You'll only make his vanity worse if you tell him how handsome he is.
sentences.chinese: 你告訴他他長的有多帥只會讓他的虛榮心更嚴重。

sentences.english: Our own vanity is the worst flatterer.
sentences.chinese: 我們的虛榮心是最壞的奉承者。
她挖苦的語言刺傷了他的虛榮心。

sentences.english: Yes, I admitted that I am a peacockish person.
sentences.chinese: 是的，我承認我是一個虛榮心強的人。

sentences.english: Standing free from dependence, conception, and self-conceit is the mark of liberation.
sentences.chinese: 常設擺脫依賴，概念，和自我虛榮心是解放的標誌。

sentences.english: The humorous rumour has something to do with human humanity and vanity .
sentences.chinese: 那個幽默傳聞丿人類的仁慈和虛榮心有關。

sentences.english: Usually we are more satirical from vanity than malice.
sentences.chinese: 通常，人們的尖酸刻薄來自於虛榮心而非惡意。

sentences.english: He played up to the old lady's vanity to get her support.
sentences.chinese: 他利用這老婦人的虛榮心來獲得他的支持。
蘋果的產品可以滿足虛榮心。

sentences.english: Never put on false masks to gratify vanity.
sentences.chinese: 永遠不要帶着面具去滿足你的虛榮心。
並非因爲勝利，而是因爲虛榮心。

sentences.english: His vanity was hurt by their talking so frankly.
sentences.chinese: 他們坦率的談話傷害了他的虛榮心。

definition: unimportant/not serious/it doesn't matter/never mind/it looks all right, but
to belittle/to disparage/to play down/to demean/to degrade/to devalue
to show respect from a distance (idiom)/to remain at a respectful distance
to turn a blind eye to/to ignore
